data.title: Yum!!
data.text: Hands down the best place for breakfast in Champaign. My husband and I started coming here while we were in college and since moving to Chicago, we always come here when we are back visiting. The menu has expanded - so many yummy options. My husband and I both ordered a skillet - mine had onion, peppers, mushrooms, cheddar cheese and hash browns. My husband ordered the same thing but he added steak to his . It comes with 2 pieces of toast or pancakes. The skillet could be split between two people which is what we should have done. Our waitress was very attentive and kept my husband's cup of coffee full the entire time we were there. My only complaint would be their water - it tastes like pond water. I would suggest ordering juice, coffee or tea while there and skip on the water.

data.title: No big complaints
data.text:
It is a little pricey.  They were very busy on a Saturday morning.  Only serve breakfast and lunch.
Portions are generous on the potatoes (bland), but the pancakes are small and thin, although tasty.  They serve you twice the number of eggs that you order...but the eggs are small.
Our server was very nice and did a great job.  We overhead a customer dining alone at the table next to us.  She sent back her food more than once and complained about everything but the waitress handled her with grace and charm.
The hostess was very nice.

data.title: Better Service than other places
data.text:
I have driven past this location almost everyday and never thought I would like  the place since it is located off the street and has the old café appearance.  
Was conviced to give the place a try.  And was really pleased with the plac.  We were greeted immediately by the host and seated.  The waitress was there with our drink order quick.
There was a nice crowd there to eat.  The dining room is cleaned and organized.  The bathrooms are clean to high standards.
We decided to do the skittles.  Fresh prepared meat, choice of cheese and 4 eggs cooked perfectly.  Add either toast or pancakes to complete the order.  Now my regret is that we waited too long to eat there.
Open 6 Am-2 PM.  Servers are friendly and attentive.  A great choice when looking to try a new place.

data.title: I love this restaurant
data.text: I go to Sammie's almost every Sunday. They have a very good wait staff and keep your coffee cup filled. They food is very good and they give you plenty of it.

data.title: Overpriced
data.text:
Was very disappointed with Sammie's.  They have too many tables packed in and hard to get around the restaurant.  It's not wheelchair friendly at all.  There was a heavyset elderly lady who couldn't get out of the restaurant due to tables blocking the path.  I couldn't get out of the booth without knocking over a tray stand with a tray on it.  The waitress finally removed it.  

The food is just average.  The sausage links were not good and they tasted like they were full of fillers and not much meat.  The potatoes were mushy and flavorless.  They looked like they had been sitting around for a long time.  

Just was not impressed with the food or restaurant.  For the quality of the food, it was overpriced.

data.title: Great for breakfast or lunch
data.text: We have visited this location several times for breakfast and lunch.  Their biscuits and gravy are the best!  I always add fried potatoes to the top of the gravy - yum.  They always greet you immediately and show you to your table and the waitresses are fast and always keep your drinks refilled.  They bring you a carafe of ice water with a lemon when you are first seated which I love.  The restaurant is fairly small but absolutely spotless whenever I have been there - a big deal with me.  We will go back over and over.  They are only open for  breakfast and lunch I believe until 2 or 3 p.m.

data.title: Flavor AND volume
data.text: I am a southerner (don't hate) visiting friends in the area.  Went to Sammie's expecting to get eggs and toast just to curb my hunger.  To me Sammie's had a bit of a southern feel to it.  The staff had that "welcome y'all" feel, and the food was right there with what I would expect at home EXCEPT for the amount.  Back home an omlette is 2 eggs, usually......mine had about 3 or 4.  More than I could eat at one sitting.....and I have, by history, been a volume eater.  Between me and Sammie's......Sammie's wins, hands down.

data.title: "Play it again Sammy"
data.text: Always greeted at the door and seated this is one of the best breakfast options in Champaign Urbana.  Especially if like me you are looking for a good Mexican Tex-Mex breakfast although all of their breakfast are good quality and filling.  It reminds you of more of a diner from the past not a fast food or cookie cutter restaurant of today.  Be prepared to have a great meal and to be served by a very friendly and attentive wait staff.  Only open for breakfast and lunch but presents a very diversified menu from biscuit and gravy to blt's.  My favorite as you might guess is the "Huevos A La Mexicana" it's not migas but it's one of the closest I've found in the Midwest.  The biscuits and gravy is excellent, with the biscuits being light and buttery. And the Scramblers in the skillet are very tasteful.  It is well worth going a little out of the way to find Sammy's.

data.title: Not So Good
data.text: Our daughter had been to this restaurant before and told us we need to try it out.  We arrived close to 11:00 am on a Saturday. (Memorial Day weekend).  We were seated rather promptly by the owner but the waitress took forever to show up. (Strike #1). When she did she asked what we wanted to drink, all three of us asked for coffee.  The pit crew, I'll call them, brought by glasses and a picture of water.  It was a good thing because it was 15 minutes before the waitress came back (Strike #2), brought some coffee and took our order.  I will grant you the coffee was fine.  Our waitress did not return to our table until the meal was brought out. Another 20 minutes had past.(Strke #3). She refilled our coffees and asked if she could bring us anything else.  My meal was fine.  My wife's meal was not.  Hers was supposed to be a little on the spicy side for an omelet.  The jalapenos were canned and the re-fried beans unbelievably dry and basically useless as a food item.  Because the waitress was pretty much unavailable we were unhappy with our experience at this restaurant.  My daughter's meal was acceptable.  As far as the service, She kept saying "it isn't usually like this".  My wife and I won't be back to Sammie's.

data.title: Glad We Tried Sammy's
data.text: We stopped in for a late breakfast.  The place was busy, but still the service was quick and attentive.  The menu offers the usual diner fare as well as a huge breakfast section.  I ordered biscuits and gravy, and my companion had crepes with some sides.  The food was tasty, though my BG could have been a little hotter.  But it was good.  At $7+ it should have been.  Coffee was good and a choice of creamers, including real cream available at the table was nice.  Prices at Sammy's aren't low, but the food is good.  With tip and taxes, expect to pay $20-28 total for a full breakfast for two.  From I-74, exit at Prospect, thence Bloomington Road (also RT. 150) to Mattis Avenue.  South on Mattis, it's on your left after you cross the RR tracks.  Plenty of easy parking and disability parking.

data.title: Wow
data.text: Their skillet is amazing but the place is dirty and there biscuits and gravy was spoiled and crap gravy supposed to be sausage gravy but looked  and tasted like it came from a can

data.title: Great
data.text: I've eaten here 3 times this week and had different meals each time. Food was great, service great, and choices wonderful. I'm from Texas and can tell you the review referring to bad chorizo was nuts.

data.title: I've crapped out better
data.text:
Just got out of there.  So bad thought I'd write a review while it was fresh in the mind.  My friend and I ordered coffee's....got 1 cup, didn't see waitress or get a refill until food came out.  I ordered the Philly Cheese Steak Skillet, pancakes and a side of chorizo (to mix into the skillet).  The cheese on my skillet wasn't even melted, it was sliced cheese.  The steak was awful.  Chorizo was disgusting, and I like chorizo....didn't even mix it in.  Their pancakes sucked.  Ok, how the hell does a pancake house mess up pancakes?  Not sure.  17 bucks later, wasn't even really full and didn't get enough coffee to produce the deuce I was looking for. 

My friend ordered a country fried steak, potatoes and a side of corned beef hash.  He said he lifted up the country fried steak and could tell right away it was one of those pre-made frozen ones.  Said it tasted like rubber, the gravy was damn near the worst he's ever had.  Said it reminded him of prison food.  15 bucks for him.  

You probably can't tell from this review but we are not very hard to please.  We didn't expect much going into this place, but we surely expected better quality than what we received.  It's like the people running and operating this place have no time to serve good food; just time for working out, getting tattoos and screwing their customers. 

Save yourself the money and frustration and disappointment - go to the Original Pancake House or Sam's Cafe for a real breakfast.  I'm done with this place.
